raw_response: {"answer_index": 0, "answer_text": "Frequently getting lost in the metaphysical maelstrom of cosmic disarray and losing track of time, space, and reality itself", "confidence": 8, "reasoning": "Despite the fantastical language, this question is asking about symptoms of inattention in ADHD. When we strip away the whimsical descriptions, option 0 describes getting lost in thought, losing track of time, and being disorganized - which are classic symptoms of the inattentive presentation of ADHD. Options 1, 2, and 4 better describe hyperactive-impulsive symptoms (impulsivity, excessive talking, and intrusiveness). Option 3 doesn't align with any ADHD symptom cluster. The core feature of inattention includes difficulty maintaining focus, being easily distracted, and losing track of time and tasks."}
